A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Interesting that the majority of positive reviews are full on 5 stars and comprised of a couple of sentences. Whereas the negative reviews are mostly longer and lay out good reasons for their views. That indicates planted positive reviews to me. 

The idea that people don't like this movie because it is "different" is nonsense. If anything\, it is more a tired\, formulaic retread of past movies\, but done by someone who doesn't understand these characters or this universe. That's why people don't like it. It feel like it was written by committee and forced into the Marvel mold. It has a cheesy Guardians of the Galaxy feel\, not Star Wars. That is not being "different"\, it is forcing the uniqueness of Star Wars into a dull\, formulatic superhero movie mold.

There's nothing original about this movie. It didn't go in a new or remotely interesting direction. Everything is played safe and boring. The classic characters are not portrayed correctly or are wasted in stupid scenes. The Yoda cameo was terrible. Luke wasn't Luke. 

While prequels had many faults\, they were original and followed a singular\, if flawed\, vision. These new movies are fomulatic cash grabs. 

This new trilogy is supposed to be the continuation of episodes 1-6\, not a brand new story or tone. That's what the stand alone movies and upcoming new trilogies are for. These movies are supposed to be modern mythology. And this fails so badly it's not likely to be fixable in episode 9. There is no mythology left\, it was destroyed in this movie. All we have left now is pissed off pouty boy Kylo Ren.

Disney has ruined Star Wars\, as we knew they would. They will run it into the ground for as long as they can make money from it. Which should be many years of generic\, unoriginal movies.
